definition: variant of 思維|思维[si1 wei2]

sentences.english: Confucius' thought and theory of later generations produced profound influence.
sentences.chinese: 孔子地思惟及學說對後世發生啦極端深遠地影響。

sentences.english: The misconception that men are superior to women is still dominating many people's minds.
sentences.chinese: 重男輕女的偏見仍然主導着許多人的思惟。

sentences.english: After I awoke I thought that this is a good explanation of how to practice to attain original purity.
sentences.chinese: 我醒來後思惟，這是一句修學契入本淨的恰當說明。

sentences.english: They are never alone accompanied by noble thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 思惟高貴者決不會孤獨。

sentences.english: The fifth part evaluates Yang's educational ideology and practice.
sentences.chinese: 第五部門，對楊東蓴教育思惟及實踐的評價。

sentences.english: Liu Liang made a day of contemplation struggle, to no avail.
sentences.chinese: 劉亮做了一整天的思惟鬥爭，無果。

sentences.english: This insight knowledge is known as knowledge of comprehension, which comprehends all these general characteristics of material and mental phenomena.
sentences.chinese: 這種觀智稱爲思惟智，它領會了身心現象的所有共性。

sentences.english: Our assurance that twice two are four is a matter of pure intellection .
sentences.chinese: 我們確知二加二等於四，是單純的思惟作用。

sentences.english: When you've contemplated things in this way you'll see anicca , impermanence, and dukkha, unsatisfactoriness.
sentences.chinese: 當你如此思惟，就會看見無常與苦。

sentences.english: The thesis is divided into five parts to expound Yang's educational ideology and practice.
sentences.chinese: 本文共分五個部門來闡述楊東蓴的教育思惟與實踐。

definition: (of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
to understand/to comprehend the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha
the thirty-two physical characteristics of Buddha
arhat (Sanskrit)/a holy man who has left behind all earthly desires and concerns and attained nirvana (Buddhism)
actual situation/the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)

the Four Noble Truths (Budd.), covered by the acronym 苦集滅道: all life is suffering 苦, the cause of suffering is desire 集, emancipation comes only by eliminating passions 滅|灭, the way 道 to emancipation is the Eight-fold Noble Way 八正道
the Four Noble Truths (Buddhism)/see also 四諦|四谛[si4 di4] and 苦集滅道|苦集灭道[ku3 ji2 mie4 dao4]

the Four Noble Truths (Budd.), namely: all life is suffering 苦, the cause of suffering is desire 集, emancipation comes only by eliminating passions 滅|灭, the way 道 to emancipation is the Eight-fold Noble Way 八正道/also called 四諦|四谛
to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
